front.p: 1870 April 4: to HectorMuseum of New Zealand—Te Papa Tongarewa MU000147/003/0077

body.p: I am just posting my official Letter to the Native Secretary—explanatory of delay in sending them copy of Maori Lex., owing to Rheumatism,—and in it I have ventured to say, several of their officials, here, visited me & saw me in my helpless state—also, “Dr.H. of Wellington”, so if you would kindly tell Cooper, or Gisborne, or McLean (if there), that you saw me so, I will thank you: I write in haste. Hope you are well.
